content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.

  1. Select three expressions that are perfect squares.
  • \(9x^2+24x+16\)
  • \(2x^2+20x+100\)
  • \((7-3x)^2\)
  • \((5x+4)(5x-4)\)
  • \((1-2x)(-2x+1)\)
  • \(4x^2+6x+94\)

Answer: \(9x^2+24x+16\), \((7-3x)^2\), \((1-2x)(-2x+1)\)

  1. Find the missing number that makes the expression a perfect square.
  1. \(49x^2-\_\_\_\_\_\_x+16\)

Answer: 56
\(49x^2-56x+16\)

  1. \(36x^2+\_\_\_\_\_\_x+4\)

Answer: 24
\(36x^2+24x+4\)

  1. \(4x^2-\_\_\_\_\_\_x+25\)

Answer: 20
\(4x^2-20x+25\)

  1. \(9x^2+\_\_\_\_\_\_x+9\)

Answer: 18
\(9x^2+18x+9\)

  1. \(121x^2+\_\_\_\_\_\_x+9\)

Answer: 66
\(121x^2+66x+9\)

  1. Choose the completely factored form of the expression.
  1. \(49x^2-56x+16\)
  • \((7x+4)^2\)
  • \((49x-16)^2\)
  • \((7x-4)^2\)
  • \((28x-11)^2\)

Answer: \((7x-4)^2\)

  1. \(36x^2+24x+4\)
  • \((6x-2)^2\)
  • \((36x+4)^2\)
  • \((6x+2)^2\)
  • \(4(3x+1)^2\)

Answer: \(4(3x+1)^2\)

  1. \(4x^2-20x+25\)
  • (\(10x+7)^2\)
  • \((2x-5)^2\)
  • \((4x-25)^2\)
  • \((2x+5)^2\)

Answer: \((2x-5)^2\)

  1. \(121x^2+66x+9\)
  • \((11x+3)^2\)
  • \((121x-9)^2\)
  • \((3x-3)^2\)
  • \((11x-3)^2\)

Answer: \((11x+3)^2\)

  1. Find the missing number that makes the expression a perfect square.
  1. \(9x^2+42x+\_\_\_\_\_\)

Answer: 49
\(9x^2+42x+49\)

  1. \(49x^2-28x+\_\_\_\_\_\)

Answer: 4
\(49x^2-28x+4\)

  1. \(25x^2+110x+\_\_\_\_\_\)

Answer: 121
\(25x^2+110x+121\)

  1. \(64x^2-144x+\_\_\_\_\_\)

Answer: 81
\(64x^2-144x+81\)

  1. \(4x^2+24x+\_\_\_\_\_\)

Answer: 36
\(4x^2+24x+36\)

  1. Based on your responses in question 4 above, choose the factored form of the expression.
  1. \(9x^2+42x+\_\_\_\_\_\)
  • \((3x+7)^2\)
  • \((9x-21)^2\)
  • \((3x-7)^2\)
  • \((9x+3)^2\)

Answer: \((3x+7)^2\)

  1. \(49x^2-28x+\_\_\_\_\_\)
  • \((4x+7)^2\)
  • \((7x+2)^2\)
  • \((7x-2)^2\)
  • \((7x+7)^2\)

Answer: \((7x-2)^2\)

  1. \(25x^2+110x+\_\_\_\_\_\)
  • \((5x-11)^2\)
  • \((11x+5)^2\)
  • \((11x-5)^2\)
  • \((5x+11)^2\)

Answer: \((5x+11)^2\)

  1. \(64x^2-144x+\_\_\_\_\_\)
  • \((72x-17)^2\)
  • \((8x-9)^2\)
  • \((64x-9)^2\)
  • \((8x+9)^2\)

Answer: \((8x-9)^2\)

  1. \(4x^2+24x+\_\_\_\_\_\)
  • \((2x-6)^2\)
  • \((4x-26)^2\)
  • \((2x+6)^2\)
  • \((x+6)^2\)

Answer: \((2x+6)^2\)

  1. For each expression, find the value of \(c\) to make a perfect square in standard form \((ax^2+bx+c)\).
  1. \(4x^2+4x+c\)

Answer: 1
\(4x^2+4x+1\)

  1. \(25x^2-30x+c\)

Answer: 9
\(25x^2-30x+9\)

  1. Find the value of \(c\) to make the expression a perfect square. Then, solve each equation.
  1. \(4x^2+4x+c =0\)
  • \(\frac12\)
  • \(-\frac12\)
  • \(\frac32\)
  • \(-\frac32\)
  • 2
  • \(\frac16\)

Answer: \(-\frac12\)

  1. \(25x^2-30x+c=0\)
  • \(x=\frac12\)
  • \(x=-\frac45\)
  • \(x=\frac25\)
  • \(x = 4\)
  • \(x = 5\)
  • \(x=\frac35\)

Answer: \(x=\frac35\)
